rat: Mynt operates GCash in the Philippines—an Ant Group-invested mobile wallet that expanded from payments into micro-lending and financial services, directly replicating the Alipay playbook.
Ascend Money (TrueMoney) is an Ant Group-backed e-payment and micro-lending platform in Thailand that acquired a massive wallet user base and cross-sells credit products.

One97 Communications is the parent of Paytm, India's leading mobile payments super-app that built a massive wallet/QR-payment user base and cross-sells micro-loans (Paytm Postpaid, personal loans, merchant lending) using transaction data—a textbook Ant Group-like model.

DANA is an Ant Group-backed Indonesian digital wallet that acquired a massive user base via QR/cashless payments and has cross-sold embedded micro-lending (PayLater) using transaction data, directly replicating the Ant Group playbook in Indonesia.

MoMo is Vietnam's leading mobile e-wallet that acquired a massive user base via payments/transfers and then cross-sold micro-lending, insurance, and other financial products using transaction data—directly replicating the Ant Group super-app playbook.

Maya (formerly PayMaya) is a mobile-first digital wallet and payments super-app in the Philippines—backed by Ant Group—that leverages transaction data to cross-sell consumer and merchant micro-credit products within the same app.

OVO is Indonesia's leading mobile e-wallet that expanded into consumer micro-lending (OVO PayLater) and other financial services, directly replicating the Ant Group payments-to-lending super-app flywheel in Southeast Asia.
MNT-Halan operates Egypt's leading payments and micro-lending super-app, using its payment rails and transaction data to underwrite micro-credit for underbanked consumers and merchants.
BharatPe acquired millions of merchants via free UPI/POS payment acceptance, then leveraged that transaction data to cross-sell merchant loans and credit lines within the same platform.
MobiKwik is an Indian mobile wallet that built a large payments user base and then layered on digital credit products (ZIP Pay Later, personal loans) underwritten using wallet transaction data.
Naver Financial leverages Naver Pay's dominant payments user base in South Korea to cross-sell loans, insurance, and other financial products within the Naver ecosystem.

Toss began as a mobile P2P money-transfer/payments app in Korea, amassed a massive user base, then cross-sold personal loans, insurance, and investments within the same super-app—directly replicating the payments-to-lending flywheel.

PhonePe is India's largest UPI-based mobile payments app that leverages its massive transaction user base and payment data to cross-sell personal loans and merchant credit products within the same ecosystem.

OPay is a mobile-money/payments super-app dominant in Nigeria that started with wallet and payment services for underbanked users and has expanded into embedded credit and lending products leveraging its transaction data, replicating the Ant Group playbook in West Africa.

SeaMoney (ShopeePay e-wallet + SPayLater micro-lending) replicates the Ant Group playbook across Southeast Asia: massive payment/wallet user base from the Shopee ecosystem feeds transaction data into embedded consumer and merchant micro-credit products.

GoTo Group (Gojek-Tokopedia merger) operates GoPay, one of Indonesia's largest e-wallets, and cross-sells GoPay Later and merchant lending products within the same super-app ecosystem using payment and transaction data.
PayPay is Japan's dominant QR-code mobile payment app (built with Ant Group/Paytm-derived technology) that has expanded into embedded credit via PayPay Later, using payment data for underwriting.

Ualá launched with a prepaid card and mobile wallet as its payments wedge in Argentina, built a large user base, then added personal micro-loans and other financial products within the app, fitting the payments-first lending cross-sell pattern though sometimes classed as a neobank.

Akulaku operates a digital finance super-app in Indonesia with virtual payment services, e-wallet, and consumer lending/BNPL within one ecosystem (and received Ant Group investment), though its primary acquisition wedge was installment lending rather than payments-first.

Careem is explicitly building a Middle-East 'Everything App' with an integrated Careem Pay wallet and has added BNPL/credit features, though its original user-acquisition wedge was ride-hailing rather than pure payments.

Lydia launched as a mobile P2P payment/wallet app in France and subsequently cross-sells consumer credit products within the same app, adapting the payments-first-then-lending playbook to a European market.
Paytm (One97) is India's leading QR-code mobile payment wallet with expanded lending, insurance, and wealth management services.
PhonePe is a dominant UPI/QR-code mobile payment wallet in India with expanding financial services.
DANA is an Ant-Group-backed QR-code digital wallet in Indonesia offering cashless payments, bill pay, and merchant services.
OVO is a leading QR-code digital payment wallet in Indonesia with P2P, bill pay, and financial service integrations.
PayPay is Japan's largest QR-code mobile payment wallet, modeled directly on the Alipay playbook with SoftBank/Ant Group backing.
MoMo is Vietnam's leading QR-code mobile wallet offering payments, transfers, bill pay, and expanding financial services.
Mynt operates GCash, the Philippines' dominant QR-code mobile wallet with lending, insurance, and investment services, backed by Ant Group.
stc pay is Saudi Arabia's largest digital wallet offering QR-code payments, transfers, and expanding financial services.
Maya (formerly PayMaya) is a QR-code mobile wallet and digital bank in the Philippines with payments, lending, and investment features.
Ascend Money operates TrueMoney, an Ant-Group-backed QR-code mobile wallet across Thailand and Southeast Asia with e-payments and micro-lending.
Satispay is an Italian QR-code mobile payment platform enabling merchant payments, P2P transfers, and bill payments via a consumer wallet app.
Toss is South Korea's leading mobile financial super-app with QR-code payments, P2P transfers, and comprehensive financial services.
MobiKwik is an Indian mobile wallet offering QR-code payments, bill payments, and digital credit services to mass-market consumers.
GoPay, Gojek's payment arm, is a major QR-code mobile wallet in Indonesia embedded in a super-app with expanding financial services.
SeaMoney/ShopeePay is a QR-code mobile wallet within Sea's e-commerce super-app across Southeast Asia, offering payments and financial services.
Naver Financial operates Naver Pay, a QR-code mobile payment service in South Korea expanding into loans, insurance, and investments.
OPay is a mobile wallet in Nigeria offering QR-code payments, transfers, bill pay, and expanding financial services for mass-market consumers.
GoTo Group operates GoPay, one of Indonesia's leading QR-code mobile wallets, within its on-demand and e-commerce super-app ecosystem.
Uzum operates a digital payment wallet in Uzbekistan within a broader ecosystem of e-commerce and business services.
NIO is a premium DTC EV brand in China with branded stores, battery-swap infrastructure, OTA updates, and aspirational tech positioning.
Xpeng is a Chinese DTC smart EV startup with software-defined features, OTA updates, and branded retail stores.
Zeekr is a premium DTC electric vehicle brand from Geely operating with branded stores, software-defined features, and OTA updates.
Polestar is a purpose-built premium electric performance brand selling DTC through branded retail spaces, despite Geely/Volvo parentage.
Li Auto is a Chinese premium DTC EV brand with branded retail stores, connected software features, and OTA updates, though using range-extender technology.
Leapmotor is a Chinese DTC EV startup with in-house developed intelligent driving systems, branded stores, and technology-differentiated positioning.
Avatr is a premium EV brand with DTC branded retail, Huawei-powered intelligent driving, and software-defined vehicle architecture.
Zhiji Auto (IM Motors) is a premium DTC smart EV brand backed by SAIC and Alibaba with software-defined features and branded stores.
AIWAYS is a Shanghai-based smart EV startup manufacturing and selling electric vehicles with an emphasis on connected intelligence.
BYTON designed premium connected smart EVs with a DTC model and software-defined experience, positioning itself as a digital device on wheels.
WM Motor is a Chinese EV startup that designs and manufactures battery-electric vehicles sold through branded retail stores with connected features.
Voyah is a premium DTC electric vehicle brand from Dongfeng with branded retail stores and technology-differentiated positioning.
Singulato Motors is a Chinese EV startup developing new energy vehicles with smart car systems and DTC sales approach.
Youxia Motors is a Chinese startup that designs and manufactures electric vehicles with a technology-forward DTC approach.
Hozon (Neta brand) is a Chinese EV startup selling intelligent electric vehicles DTC through branded retail channels.
NIUTRON is a high-end new energy vehicle brand with DTC ambitions, though it has limited production traction.
Bordrin Motors is a Chinese smart EV startup developing intelligent electric vehicles, though it faced financial difficulties limiting market presence.
ENOVATE Motors is a Chinese EV startup in the premium segment, though limited information and market traction create uncertainty.
ROX Motor is a Chinese new energy vehicle startup focused on off-road EVs, fitting the startup DTC model but in a niche segment.
GAC Aion is a spun-off EV entity with branded stores and tech-differentiated positioning, but originates from legacy OEM GAC Group.

Latin America's dominant C2C marketplace replicating the eBay model with auction and fixed-price listings, transaction commissions, and an asset-light two-sided platform for individual sellers and SMBs.
Indonesia's leading C2C marketplace connecting individual and small-merchant sellers with consumers on an asset-light platform with no owned inventory.
Japan's dominant C2C marketplace app for buying and selling secondhand and new items, replicating eBay's two-sided model with commission-based monetization.
China's major secondhand C2C marketplace where users buy and sell used goods, directly replicating the eBay-like peer-to-peer mechanism.

Avito is Russia's dominant C2C classifieds and marketplace platform where individual users list and sell used goods across horizontal categories, monetizing via promoted listings and transaction fees without holding inventory.

Carousell Group is a horizontal C2C classifieds/marketplace platform in Southeast Asia where individuals list and sell items (especially preloved goods) with no platform-held inventory, monetizing via promoted listings and transaction fees.

Hyper-local horizontal C2C marketplace for buying and selling secondhand goods, asset-light with no inventory, monetized via promoted listings and transaction fees — a clear geographic variant of the eBay playbook in Spain.

Karrot (formerly Danggeun Market) is a hyperlocal C2C secondhand goods marketplace in Korea connecting individual sellers and buyers without holding inventory, monetizing via optional promoted listings and transaction fees.

letgo is a horizontal C2C marketplace for buying and selling used goods locally, matching the asset-light two-sided marketplace mechanism with no inventory holding, monetized via promoted listings and transaction services.

C2C online marketplace for secondhand clothing where sellers list items, the platform holds no inventory, and monetizes via transaction fees and promoted listings — directly replicating the eBay-like two-sided mechanism.
Indian horizontal marketplace connecting buyers and sellers in a managed environment, focused on value-segment goods with an asset-light, commission-based model.

Horizontal C2C classifieds and online marketplace in India where individuals and small merchants buy, sell, and rent across many categories — a direct geographic replication of the eBay-like asset-light two-sided marketplace.
India's leading value e-commerce marketplace connecting sellers with price-conscious buyers without holding inventory, closely replicating the eBay horizontal marketplace model.

Operates horizontal classifieds portals in emerging markets, connecting individual sellers with buyers across multiple categories without holding inventory — a direct geographic variant of the C2C marketplace playbook.

Online C2C/C2B2C marketplace for pre-owned luxury fashion where sellers list and buyers purchase through platform trust mechanisms; fits the secondhand marketplace variant though narrower in category scope than a fully horizontal platform.
Parent company of Taobao, the world's largest C2C marketplace, though the group entity encompasses B2B, cloud, logistics, and other businesses well beyond the pure marketplace model.

Chrono24 connects individual and small-merchant watch sellers with buyers on a platform holding no inventory, using the same two-sided marketplace mechanism with trust/authentication features, though it is vertical (luxury watches) rather than horizontal.

Asset-light online marketplace for new and used automobiles connecting individual sellers and small dealers with buyers, replicating the two-sided marketplace mechanism but in a single vertical rather than horizontal.
South Korea's Amazon analogue with massive proprietary logistics network powering Rocket Delivery (same-day/next-day), broad horizontal catalog, and a Rocket WOW membership program.
India's leading horizontal e-commerce platform with owned Ekart logistics for warehousing and last-mile delivery, 1P+3P marketplace, and Flipkart Plus loyalty program.
China's premier full-stack e-commerce retailer with one of the world's largest proprietary logistics networks including warehouses, sortation centers, and last-mile delivery fleet.
Pan-African horizontal e-commerce marketplace with proprietary Jumia Logistics providing warehousing and last-mile delivery across multiple African countries.
Southeast Asia's full-stack e-commerce platform (Alibaba-backed) with owned logistics infrastructure including warehouses and last-mile delivery across six SEA markets.
Turkey's dominant e-commerce platform with Trendyol Express owned logistics network, broad horizontal catalog, and integrated fulfillment centers.
Latin America's dominant e-commerce marketplace with Mercado Envíos owned/controlled logistics including fulfillment centers and last-mile delivery, plus broad horizontal catalog.
Middle East's leading e-commerce marketplace (acquired by Amazon) with owned fulfillment centers and Q-Express delivery network covering UAE and the broader region.
JD.com's Indonesian replication deploying the same full-stack 1P retail model with owned warehousing and delivery infrastructure adapted for the Indonesian market.
Operator of Shopee, Southeast Asia's largest e-commerce marketplace, which has built proprietary Shopee Express (SPX) logistics for fulfillment and last-mile delivery across multiple countries.

Operates China's largest consumer e-commerce platforms (Taobao, Tmall) with integrated Cainiao logistics network providing warehousing and delivery coordination, though more platform-orchestrated than fully owned.
GoTo Group combines Tokopedia's horizontal e-commerce marketplace with Gojek's on-demand logistics network, creating an integrated commerce-plus-delivery ecosystem in Indonesia.

Zalando combines 1P retail with a large 3P partner marketplace and operates its own fulfillment centers (ZFS) across Europe, mirroring the full-stack logistics playbook, though its catalog still skews heavily toward fashion rather than full horizontal breadth.
Indonesia's major horizontal marketplace with TokoCabang fulfillment services and, post-GoTo merger, access to integrated logistics, though historically more asset-light than the anchor model.
99 is a known Uber-for-Brazil ride-hailing marketplace connecting riders with driver-partners via its mobile app.
Bolt replicates the Uber ride-hailing marketplace model across Europe and Africa, matching riders with independent drivers via app.
Cabify is a ride-hailing marketplace operating in Spain and Latin America, connecting riders with driver-partners through its app.
Careem is the Uber-for-Middle-East ride-hailing marketplace (later acquired by Uber) that expanded into a super-app with ride-hailing as its founding wedge.
Didi is China's dominant ride-hailing marketplace connecting riders with independent driver-partners, directly replicating the Uber model at massive scale.
Gojek launched as a motorcycle ride-hailing marketplace in Indonesia and expanded into a super-app, with ride-hailing as its founding wedge.
Grab is the dominant Uber-for-Southeast-Asia ride-hailing marketplace that expanded into a super-app with ride-hailing as the original wedge.
Ola is India's leading ride-hailing marketplace connecting riders with independent driver-partners via its mobile app, a clear Uber-for-India.
Gett operates a ride-hailing marketplace in the UK and Israel, matching riders with drivers (including black cab drivers) via its app with commission-based revenue.
Rapido operates a bike-taxi and auto-rickshaw ride-hailing marketplace in India, matching riders with independent driver-partners via app (motorcycle/auto variant in scope).
Kakao Mobility runs a taxi-hailing marketplace in South Korea, matching riders with taxi drivers through its app with marketplace dynamics.
Yandex operates Yandex Go (formerly Yandex.Taxi), a major ride-hailing marketplace in Russia/CIS, though Yandex itself is primarily a tech/search conglomerate.
Yidao Yongche was an early Chinese ride-hailing platform connecting riders with drivers via app, though its description as 'professional car reservation services' suggests partial fleet elements.
Lending Club is the defining US replication of Zopa's P2P marketplace, connecting borrowers with individual and institutional investors via an online platform.
Prosper Marketplace is a direct US competitor to Lending Club, operating the same two-sided P2P marketplace matching borrowers with investor-lenders.
Lufax is China's largest P2P/marketplace lending platform, matching borrowers with individual and institutional investors in a direct replication of the Zopa model.
Dianrong is a Chinese online marketplace lending platform explicitly designed to connect borrowers with investors, co-founded by a Lending Club co-founder.
Tuandaiwang is a Chinese peer-to-peer lending platform that matches borrowers with individual investor-lenders via its online marketplace.
Weidai is explicitly described as a China-based P2P lending platform, directly matching borrowers with individual and institutional investors.
Plenti (formerly RateSetter Australia) is an Australian P2P lending platform matching borrowers with investor-lenders, replicating the Zopa model for Australia.
9F Group operated a Chinese P2P lending marketplace connecting borrowers with individual and institutional investors as a core part of its digital financial platform.
SoFi originated as a P2P marketplace matching student borrowers with alumni investors but has since evolved into a full-service digital bank, moving beyond the pure marketplace model.
Chinese AI chip startup designing GPU and DSA-architecture intelligent processors as a domestic alternative amid US export controls.
Chinese GPU designer providing graphics processing technology and services to corporate clients as a domestic NVIDIA alternative.
Chinese AI chip company building core processor chips for intelligent cloud servers, terminals, and robots with its own software stack.
South Korean AI accelerator chip designer developing inference-optimized silicon and data center systems for large-scale AI workloads.
UK-based company designing the Intelligence Processing Unit (IPU), a novel AI accelerator architecture with its own Poplar software stack.
Israeli company designing dedicated AI processors optimized for edge inference, replicating the AI chip model for edge deployment.

Horizon Robotics designs its own AI inference processors (BPU series) with an integrated software stack, targeting edge AI for autonomous driving — a clear AI accelerator chip designer in the automotive/edge domain.
Chinese company designing AI accelerator chips targeting autonomous driving and edge AI inference applications.
Israeli company designing novel HPC compute architectures that overlap with AI workloads, though not exclusively focused on AI acceleration.
Despegar is the leading Latin American OTA offering flights, hotels, and packages to consumers—a clear Expedia-for-LatAm clone.
MakeMyTrip is India's leading full-service OTA providing flights, hotels, holiday packages, and bus bookings from multiple suppliers.
Trip.com (Ctrip international brand) is a major full-service OTA offering flights, hotels, and packaged tours across Asia and globally.
Despegar USA is the same Latin American full-service OTA brand enabling consumers to search and book flights, hotels, and travel packages.
Yatra is a major Indian OTA enabling consumers to search and book flights, hotels, and holiday packages from multiple suppliers.
LY.com is a Chinese full-service OTA enabling consumers to book flights, hotels, and travel tickets from multiple suppliers.
Tuniu is a Chinese consumer OTA specializing in packaged tours and travel products with flight and hotel booking capabilities.
Hopper is a mobile-first OTA using predictive analytics to help consumers book flights, hotels, and car rentals directly on-platform.
ixigo has evolved from metasearch into a full-service Indian OTA enabling direct booking of flights, trains, buses, and hotels.
Yanolja is Korea's leading accommodation/leisure booking platform with expanding travel services, though it is more accommodation-centric than a full-service OTA.
Lvmama is a Chinese B2C tourism platform offering scenic tickets, hotel booking, and packaged tours, though its flight inventory is limited compared to full-service OTAs.
French geo variant training frontier open-weight and proprietary LLMs with API and enterprise offerings, benefiting from EU data-sovereignty positioning.
Canadian geo variant training Command R family of enterprise LLMs with developer API and enterprise platform.
Israeli geo variant training Jamba foundation models and commercializing via API and enterprise products.
Chinese geo variant training Yi series LLMs for the Chinese market with API and consumer products.
Chinese geo variant training GLM foundation models with consumer chat (ChatGLM) and developer API offerings.
Chinese geo variant training frontier LLMs and offering Kimi consumer chat product with long-context capabilities.
Chinese-origin company training multimodal foundation models (text, audio, video) with consumer products (Hailuo) and developer APIs.
Chinese geo variant training Step series large language and multimodal models with API and consumer offerings.
UK company that trains StableLM language models alongside its image models and offers them via API, though primarily known for image generation.
US-based BNPL provider offering merchant-integrated installment payments at online checkout with major retailers like Amazon and Shopify merchants.
Italian BNPL provider offering pay-in-3/4 interest-free installment options integrated at merchant checkout across Southern Europe.
Saudi Arabia-based BNPL provider offering merchant-integrated installment payments at checkout across the Middle East and North Africa.
Japanese BNPL provider enabling cardless installment purchases integrated at merchant online checkout, the Klarna model adapted for Japan.
US-based BNPL provider offering pay-in-4 interest-free installment plans integrated at merchant e-commerce checkout.
Saudi Arabia-based BNPL provider offering split-payment installment options at merchant checkout across MENA markets.
Indonesian BNPL and digital finance platform offering installment payment options integrated at e-commerce merchant checkouts across Southeast Asia.

Advance Intelligence Group operates Atome, a prominent merchant-integrated BNPL service across Southeast Asia that lets consumers split purchases into interest-free installments at checkout, closely replicating the Klarna playbook.
UK-based BNPL provider offering pay-over-time installment options with merchant integration, though differentiated by an ad-subsidized direct-to-consumer model.
Singapore-headquartered provider offering instant BNPL credit at e-commerce checkout in Indonesia through integrations with major marketplace platforms.
US-based point-of-sale BNPL provider integrating at service-merchant checkouts (auto, dental, optical) to offer consumers installment payments with proprietary underwriting.
Stripe for India — developer-first API payment gateway adapted for Indian payment methods (UPI, wallets, net banking) and local regulations.
Stripe for Nigeria/Africa — API-first payment gateway enabling African businesses to accept online payments with local payment method coverage.
Stripe for Indonesia/Southeast Asia — developer-friendly API payment platform covering local payment methods like bank transfers and e-wallets.
API payment gateway for African markets enabling businesses to accept payments across multiple African countries via developer-friendly APIs.
Stripe for Latin America — integrated API payments platform supporting local payment methods across multiple LatAm countries.
Global API-first payments platform that aggregates and simplifies local payment methods across many geographies for developer integration.
API payment gateway specializing in enabling cross-border merchants to accept and send payments across emerging markets in Africa, Asia, and Latin America.
Offers API-based online payment acceptance alongside its primary cross-border treasury product, fitting the model partially for global internet businesses.
Developer-first API platform for collecting bank-to-bank (direct debit) payments, applying the Stripe-like developer experience to recurring bank payment collection.
iZettle pioneered the Square-like mPOS card reader and app model for small businesses across Europe, starting in Sweden.
SumUp provides affordable mobile card readers with simple pricing for micro and small merchants across Europe and beyond.
Clip is the leading mPOS card reader and digital payments platform enabling small merchants in Mexico to accept card payments.
Flatpay provides POS terminals and payment processing to SMB merchants in Denmark with flat-rate pricing, replicating the Square model.
CloudWalk provides smart POS payment terminals to small and micro-merchants in Brazil, enabling card acceptance in a cash-heavy market.
Teya (formerly Saltpay) provides affordable card payment terminals and business tools to SMBs in Europe with fair, simplified pricing.
Mercado Pago offers mPOS card readers (Point) with flat-rate pricing for small merchants across Latin America, directly replicating the Square model.
Viva Wallet offers cloud-based card acceptance terminals for SMBs in Southern Europe with simplified onboarding and competitive pricing.
Moniepoint distributes POS terminals to merchants and agents in Nigeria, enabling card and digital payment acceptance for previously cash-only businesses.
OPay deploys POS terminals to agents and small merchants in Nigeria to enable digital payment acceptance, though it also functions as a broader fintech super-app.
India's leading 1P online supermarket operating its own warehouses with scheduled delivery across time windows, a direct FreshDirect-for-India analog.
Czech online grocery retailer with own warehouses and scheduled same-day/next-day delivery windows across Central Europe.
Norwegian online grocery retailer with centralized fulfillment and scheduled door-to-door delivery, the FreshDirect model for Scandinavia.
Dutch online grocer with 1P inventory, centralized fulfillment, and scheduled time-window delivery via electric vans.
South Korean 1P online grocery retailer with its own fulfillment centers and overnight/next-day scheduled delivery (dawn delivery).
Chinese fresh produce e-commerce platform operating 1P inventory from regional warehouses with scheduled delivery, a known example in this playbook.
One of China's earliest fresh food e-commerce platforms selling from own cold-chain warehouses with scheduled delivery, replicating the FreshDirect model for China.
Indian online meat and seafood retailer with end-to-end 1P supply chain and scheduled delivery; fits as a niche specialty variant though limited to a single fresh-food subcategory.
Bitso is Mexico's leading regulated retail crypto exchange offering local-currency (MXN) fiat on/off-ramps via domestic banking integration.
CoinDCX is an India-focused regulated retail crypto exchange with INR fiat rails and local KYC, serving mainstream Indian crypto investors.
Dunamu operates Upbit, South Korea's dominant regulated retail crypto exchange with KRW fiat on-ramps and local VASP registration.
CoinSwitch is an India-focused retail crypto exchange platform with INR on-ramps and local regulatory compliance, directly competing with CoinDCX.
Rain is a Bahrain-licensed regulated retail crypto exchange serving MENA markets with local fiat currency on/off-ramps and domestic banking partnerships.
2TM is the parent company of Mercado Bitcoin, Brazil's leading regulated retail crypto exchange with BRL fiat rails and local licensing.
Liquid Global is a Japan-based JFSA-licensed retail crypto exchange with JPY fiat rails, serving mainstream Japanese crypto investors.
HashKey Group operates a licensed retail virtual asset exchange in Hong Kong under SFC regulation, though the parent group spans broader financial services and consulting.
Commission-free self-directed stock and ETF trading platform targeting UK retail investors with a premium subscription tier — Robinhood for the UK.
Mobile-first commission-free brokerage offering stocks, ETFs, and crypto to European retail investors — Robinhood for Germany/Europe.
Mobile-first zero-commission stock and mutual fund trading app targeting first-time retail investors in Indonesia — Robinhood for Indonesia.
Mobile-first commission-free platform for stocks, mutual funds, and ETFs targeting young Indian retail investors — Robinhood for India.
Mobile-first online brokerage offering low-cost stock and ETF trading to retail investors across Singapore and other Asian markets.

Indian mobile-first investment app (CoinSwitch Kuber) targeting first-time retail investors with simplified crypto and stock trading UX, positioning similar to known examples Groww and Zerodha, though primarily described as a crypto exchange and revenue model relies on spread markup rather than PFOF
Udaan is a horizontal eB2B marketplace in India connecting retailers, wholesalers, and manufacturers across multiple product categories for bulk trade — a direct Alibaba.com-for-India model.

Moglix is a B2B online marketplace aggregating manufacturers and distributors of industrial and business supplies across multiple categories for business buyers, directly replicating the Alibaba.com horizontal B2B marketplace playbook in Asia.

Full-stack B2B e-commerce marketplace connecting food and grocery manufacturers/distributors with kirana/SMB retailers in India for bulk purchasing, directly matching the in-scope criterion of B2B platforms targeting kirana/corner stores.

Indian B2B e-commerce platform aggregating construction-material manufacturers and distributors for business buyers across multiple product categories (cement, steel, pipes, electricals, etc.), operating a marketplace mechanism analogous to Udaan though concentrated on the construction vertical.

B2B trade platform matching global food and agriculture buyers with sellers across many sub-categories, functioning as a cross-border wholesale marketplace though concentrated in a single broad sector.

Zetwerk explicitly operates a B2B marketplace connecting business buyers with manufacturers across multiple manufacturing categories (metals, textiles, electronics), though its emphasis on custom/contract manufacturing rather than wholesale catalog purchasing makes it a borderline fit.
Classic US restaurant food delivery marketplace aggregating local restaurant supply for consumer ordering and delivery, a known example in the playbook.
Germany-headquartered global food delivery marketplace operating in dozens of countries with commission-based restaurant aggregation model.
Brazil's dominant restaurant food ordering and delivery marketplace connecting consumers with restaurants, a known example in the playbook.
India's leading food delivery marketplace connecting consumers with restaurants via app with managed courier logistics, a known example.
Online food delivery marketplace enabling users to order from local restaurants via app/web, operating across Asia and other regions.
Operator of Baedal Minjok (Baemin), South Korea's leading restaurant food delivery marketplace, a known example in the playbook.
China's major online food delivery marketplace (Alibaba-owned) connecting consumers with local restaurants via app with courier logistics.
Kavak is the Carvana for Latin America (anchored in Mexico), acquiring, inspecting, and retailing used cars online with integrated financing and delivery.
CARS24 started as C2B in India and evolved into a full-stack used car retailer with inspection, pricing, financing, and home delivery for consumers.
Spinny is an Indian full-stack used car platform that buys, inspects, and sells pre-owned cars directly to consumers with transparent pricing and trust guarantees.
Carsome is a Southeast Asian full-stack used car e-commerce platform operating inspection centers and selling reconditioned cars with integrated financing in Malaysia.
Carro is a Singapore-based full-stack used car marketplace that holds inventory and offers integrated financing and insurance, replicating the Carvana model in Southeast Asia.
Carsome Capital is the financing and e-commerce arm of Carsome, supporting full-stack used car retail with buying, selling, and trading services.
SellerX buys and builds Amazon FBA businesses in Germany/Europe, a clear Thrasio-for-Europe aggregator.
Razor Group is a Germany-based consumer holding company that acquires and scales e-commerce marketplace brands, directly replicating Thrasio's model.
Una Brands acquires e-commerce businesses from marketplace sellers across Asia-Pacific, operating as a Thrasio-for-APAC aggregator.
GlobalBees finds and scales existing product brands in India, operating the Thrasio acquire-and-operate aggregator model for the Indian market.
Mensa Brands partners with and acquires digital-first brands in India to scale them, replicating the Thrasio aggregator model for Indian D2C brands.
Merama acquires and scales digitally native brands across Latin America, applying the Thrasio acquire-and-operate playbook to the LatAm e-commerce market.

Former anchor, demoted in Phase 3b re-election. Original rationale: Yiguo is the anchor company—an online-first fresh food e-commerce platform in China with cold-chain delivery of produce, meat, and seafood.
Benlai is a known-example Chinese fresh produce e-commerce platform focused on premium farm-to-consumer perishable delivery with cold-chain logistics.
Missfresh is a known-example Chinese fresh food e-commerce platform operating distributed mini-warehouses for rapid cold-chain delivery of perishables to urban consumers.
Licious is a known-example online-first meat and seafood platform in India with end-to-end cold-chain control, replicating the Yiguo model for the Indian market.

Dingdong Maicai is a leading Chinese fresh vegetable and produce e-commerce platform with proprietary cold-chain fulfillment delivering perishable foods directly to urban consumers, directly replicating the Yiguo-like playbook.
Womai is a known-example B2C healthy/fresh food shopping platform in China, directly competing with Yiguo in the same geography and mechanism.

Market Kurly is a South Korean online-first fresh food e-commerce platform renowned for its proprietary cold-chain 'dawn delivery' logistics, specializing in fresh produce, meat, seafood, and dairy — a direct geo-variant of the Yiguo playbook.
Sky Mavis built Axie Infinity, a play-to-earn blockchain game with NFT creatures and marketplace, replicating the Dapper Labs model from Singapore.
Sorare is a French NFT-based fantasy football platform where users buy, trade, and play with officially licensed digital cards as NFTs.
Hong Kong-based Animoca Brands builds and publishes blockchain games and NFT digital collectible experiences with true digital ownership across multiple titles.
Mythical Games develops blockchain-based video games like Blankos Block Party where in-game items are player-owned NFTs tradeable on a marketplace.
Candy Digital is a US-based NFT digital collectibles platform offering officially licensed sports NFTs (MLB) that fans can buy and trade, fitting the sports collectibles variant.
Immutable built Gods Unchained (blockchain card game with NFT ownership) and a gaming-focused NFT platform, replicating the model from Australia.
Yuga Labs creates NFT digital collectibles (BAYC, CryptoPunks) and has expanded into blockchain gaming (Otherside), though its origins lean more toward PFP collectibles than gaming.
Getir pioneered the same 1P-inventory dark-store rapid-delivery model in Turkey (2015) and later expanded to Europe, making it a textbook geographic clone.
Gorillas operated company-owned dark stores in Germany and other European cities delivering groceries within 10 minutes, a direct Gopuff/Getir clone.
Flink operates its own dark-store network in Germany promising 10-minute grocery delivery, a clear European geographic clone of the Gopuff model.
Blinkit (formerly Grofers) pivoted to a dark-store quick-commerce model in India delivering groceries and essentials within 10–20 minutes.
Zepto operates a network of dark stores in Indian cities delivering groceries within 10 minutes, a direct Indian adaptation of the quick-commerce playbook.
JOKR stocks 5k–10k SKUs in its own micro-fulfillment centers and delivers groceries within minutes, operating the Gopuff model primarily in Latin America.

Ninja is a quick-commerce operator in Saudi Arabia delivering groceries and essentials rapidly, likely using dark stores, though its 'marketplace' descriptor introduces some uncertainty about 1P inventory ownership.
Comprehensive cloud HR platform purpose-built for European SMEs with deep localization for German and EU labor/payroll regulations — a clear Workday-for-Europe play.
End-to-end enterprise HR platform covering the full employee lifecycle, localized for Indian and Southeast Asian labor-law and statutory compliance.
Cloud-native HR management platform built specifically for the Japanese market with localization for Japan's complex labor and social-insurance regulations.
China-based talent management and HR platform providing localized HCM capabilities for Chinese enterprises — Workday for China.
All-in-one HR platform automating payroll, time tracking, recruitment, and performance for European SMEs with strong Spanish and EU labor-law localization.
Cloud-based HR, payroll, and benefits platform localized for Australian and regional employment regulations — Workday for Australia/ANZ SMEs.
N26 is a known-example mobile-only consumer neobank in Germany/Europe offering fee-free accounts and debit cards, directly replicating the Chime model.
Monzo is a known-example UK mobile-only neobank providing fee-free current accounts with debit cards and modern money-management tools.
Lunar is a known-example Danish mobile-only consumer neobank offering fee-free accounts and premium tiers in Scandinavia.
Ualá offers Argentine consumers a fee-free mobile banking app with a prepaid/debit Mastercard, replicating the Chime model in a moderately banked Latin American market.
Neon is a Brazilian digital bank offering checking accounts with debit cards, low/no fees, and lending products—an account-first consumer neobank distinct from the credit-card-first Nubank model.
C6 Bank is a Brazilian mobile-first digital bank offering checking accounts with debit cards and multiple financial products, broadly matching the consumer neobank mechanism.
Bird operates a dockless shared e-scooter and e-bike fleet across cities worldwide, adapting the ofo dockless model to electric scooters in the US and beyond.
Lime operates dockless shared e-bikes and e-scooters with per-ride/per-minute pricing via a mobile app across numerous cities globally.
TIER Mobility operates a dockless shared e-scooter and e-bike fleet across European cities, replicating the ofo-like model for the European market.
VOI operates dockless shared e-scooters and e-bikes in 150+ cities across Europe with per-ride monetization, a clear geo replication of the dockless fleet model.
Beam operates a dockless shared e-scooter rental fleet in Asia-Pacific markets, replicating the dockless micro-mobility model from a Singapore base.
Neuron Mobility operates rental e-scooter and e-bike fleets docklessly in cities across Asia-Pacific and Australia, fitting the shared fleet mechanism precisely.
China's leading horizontal classifieds site covering goods, housing, jobs, and services—a direct Craigslist-for-China adaptation.
Russia's dominant multi-category classifieds platform for goods, real estate, jobs, and services, replicating the Craigslist model.
Operates horizontal classifieds portals across MENA and emerging markets covering property, motors, jobs, and general goods.
India's free horizontal classifieds platform spanning goods, services, jobs, housing, and vehicles—a clear Craigslist-for-India clone.

Carousell Group now operates horizontal classifieds across Southeast Asia (including autos, property, and general goods) through acquisitions of traditional classifieds businesses, though its roots are more mobile-first.
iQiyi is China's leading SVOD platform with a massive licensed and original content library behind a subscription paywall, directly replicating the Netflix model for the Chinese market.
Hotstar (now Disney+ Hotstar) is India's dominant SVOD streaming platform offering a large multi-genre catalog of licensed and original content behind subscription and freemium tiers.
Viu is a subscription video streaming service operating across Hong Kong and Southeast Asia with licensed Asian drama and original content, replicating the Netflix model regionally.
MUBI is a curated global SVOD streaming service and production company offering a subscription-based catalog of hand-picked films.
Vidio is Indonesia's leading OTT video platform offering licensed and original long-form content behind a subscription paywall, serving as the Netflix equivalent for Indonesia.
A direct Groupon clone for China, operating a location-based social commerce platform selling curated local deals.
Originated as China's leading Groupon-style group-buying platform for local services before evolving into a broader local commerce super-app.

Kingsoft Cloud is a leading Chinese public IaaS cloud provider offering compute, storage, and distribution services to businesses and developers in a market where US hyperscalers face regulatory barriers.
QingCloud explicitly provides IaaS-based flexible cloud services (compute, storage, networking) in China as a domestic alternative to AWS/Azure/GCP.
Personio is a comprehensive cloud HR and payroll platform built specifically for European SMEs, deeply localized for German/EU labor and tax compliance.
PayFit automates payroll and HR processes for SMBs in France (and expanding in Europe), serving as a clear Gusto-for-France replicator with deep French payroll compliance.
Employment Hero is an Australian cloud platform managing HR, payroll, and employee benefits for SMBs with deep Australian compliance integration.
Factorial is a Spain-based cloud HR platform automating payroll, time tracking, and HR administration for European SMBs with localized compliance.
SmartHR is a cloud-native HR management platform for Japanese businesses, localizing social insurance, labor procedures, and payroll compliance for the Japanese market.
Stori explicitly replicates the Nubank playbook in Mexico, offering a no-fee credit card as the entry wedge for underserved consumers with limited credit history.
Plata provides a credit card with a rewards program in Mexico targeting underserved consumers, directly mirroring the Nubank card-first entry wedge.
Ualá launched with a prepaid card as its entry product for underbanked Argentine consumers, then expanded into lending, investments, and insurance — a textbook Nubank-for-Argentina play.
slice entered India's underbanked market with a mobile-first credit card for young consumers and is now building a full-stack digital bank, replicating the Nubank mechanism.
FPL Technologies is building a mobile-first credit card from first principles for Indian consumers, using the card as the primary acquisition wedge in an underserved market.
India's leading eB2B platform connecting small retailers with wholesalers/manufacturers for FMCG and everyday goods, directly replicating the Huimin model.
B2B e-commerce ecosystem purpose-built for corner stores in Latin America, providing FMCG sourcing, delivery, and credit—classic geo replication.
Indonesian wholesale e-commerce marketplace providing inventory sourcing and working capital to small warung/shop owners, a direct Udaan/Huimin-style adaptation.
Full-stack B2B marketplace for food and grocery distribution to small/independent retailers (kirana stores) in India with embedded logistics and credit.

ElasticRun is an Indian technology-driven distribution platform that connects FMCG brands with small and underserved rural/semi-urban retailers via app-based ordering and managed logistics, operating in the same Indian kirana-digitization space as Udaan and Jumbotail.
Mercari is Japan's leading mobile-first C2C secondhand marketplace with photo-centric listings, in-app payments, and shipping — a direct OfferUp analog for Japan.
Wallapop is a hyper-local, mobile-first C2C secondhand goods marketplace in Spain, replicating the OfferUp model with location-based discovery.
Letgo is a mobile-first C2C marketplace for used goods originating in Turkey, directly mirroring OfferUp's ultra-low-friction photo-to-listing model.
Carousell Group operates mobile-first C2C secondhand marketplaces across Southeast Asia, directly replicating the OfferUp mechanism in multiple Asian geographies.

Horizon Robotics designs proprietary automotive-grade Journey SoCs bundled with ADAS/AD perception software and sells integrated platforms to Chinese OEMs for series production, directly replicating Mobileye's model for China.

Black Sesame Technologies develops its own automotive-grade ADAS/AD SoCs (Huashan series) with integrated perception software, selling the platform to Chinese OEMs in a clear Mobileye-for-China pattern.

Former anchor, demoted in Phase 3b re-election. Original rationale: Vipshop is the canonical originator of the flash-sale branded discount e-commerce model in China, offering time-limited sales of well-known brands at deep discounts.
GDS designs, builds, and operates colocation data centers in China, serving hyperscale and enterprise tenants under long-term contracts — a direct Equinix-for-China model.
Princeton Digital Group invests in, develops, and operates data center infrastructure across Asia, leasing capacity to hyperscale cloud and enterprise customers — Equinix-for-Asia-Pacific.
DayOne develops and operates hyperscale digital infrastructure in Southeast Asia, leasing data center capacity to cloud, AI, and enterprise customers — Equinix-for-Singapore/SEA.
Rocket Internet clone of Zappos for Europe, now Europe's largest multi-brand online fashion retailer with the same free shipping/returns playbook.
Rocket Internet clone of Zappos for Brazil/Latin America, offering multi-brand fashion retail with the same logistics-heavy, free-returns model.
Rocket Internet umbrella operating Zappos-like multi-brand fashion e-commerce platforms across 27+ emerging markets.
Major European multi-brand fashion retailer offering personalized shopping across thousands of third-party brands with free shipping and returns.
China-based platform replicating the iTutorGroup model by connecting Chinese students with North American tutors for live 1-on-1 English tutoring sessions via proprietary video technology.
Austria-based live tutoring marketplace that matches K-12 students with vetted tutors for 1-on-1 video sessions, handling scheduling, payments, and quality assurance across European markets.

India-based live online tutoring platform connecting students with tutors for 1-on-1 and small-group interactive sessions for academic and competitive exam prep, with platform-managed scheduling and payments.
Clara is a Brex-like corporate card and end-to-end spend management platform built for Latin American businesses.
Volopay issues corporate cards with automated payables and spend controls for businesses in the APAC region, a clear Brex-for-Singapore/SEA model.
Payhawk offers global corporate cards with expense tracking, automated payables, and real-time financial controls for European businesses.
Spenmo offers corporate cards and expense management for finance teams in Southeast Asia, replicating the Brex model for the SGP/SEA geography.

Zai Lab's core model is in-licensing transformative medicines from Western biotech/pharma for clinical development and commercialization in China, a textbook geo-variant of SymBio for the Chinese market.
JW Therapeutics was a joint venture formed specifically to in-license Juno/BMS CAR-T technology and commercialize it in China, fitting the in-license-and-localize playbook precisely.
Known example; tech-enabled e-commerce express parcel delivery network operating its own sorting and delivery infrastructure across Southeast Asia.
Known example; J&T Express built a full-stack e-commerce parcel delivery network with owned sorting hubs and last-mile fleet, originating in Indonesia.
Known example; Indian e-commerce express delivery company operating its own sorting infrastructure and delivery fleet, directly competing with Delhivery.
Northvolt is explicitly replicating the CATL gigafactory playbook in Sweden/Europe to supply European OEMs like BMW and Volkswagen with locally produced battery cells.
Verkor is building a gigafactory in Dunkirk, France to manufacture low-carbon battery cells for European automotive OEMs including Renault, directly replicating the CATL model for France.

Britishvolt aimed to build the UK's first gigafactory for automotive battery cells to provide domestic supply sovereignty, a direct geo-replication of the CATL playbook for the UK (though it entered administration).
Parloa is the known European (Germany) adaptation of Ada's AI-first contact center automation model, building an AI agent management platform to automate customer interactions for enterprises.
Decagon provides a conversational AI platform purpose-built for automating customer support across multiple channels, directly replicating Ada's mechanism in the US market.
Sierra builds and manages conversational AI agents specifically for customer experiences, functioning as a direct US competitor to Ada with the same AI-first support resolution model.
Nuvemshop is the leading Shopify-equivalent in Brazil, providing SMBs with self-serve tools to set up, manage, and promote their own online stores.
Facily is a Brazilian social commerce marketplace focused on low-ticket items with group-buying mechanics, replicating the Pinduoduo model for Brazil.
DealShare is an Indian social group-buying platform targeting price-sensitive consumers in lower-tier cities with WhatsApp-driven sharing and bulk discounts.
CityMall is an Indian social commerce platform targeting Tier-2/3 cities and villages, using community leaders and group-buying mechanics to reach price-sensitive, new-to-internet users.
Hong Kong-based DTC fast fashion brand explicitly targeting overseas Gen-Z consumers with trend-driven, affordable apparel sourced from Chinese supply chains, directly replicating Shein's mechanism.
India-based global D2C fast fashion brand offering trendy and affordable styles with a digital-native model, representing a Shein-like approach adapted from/for the Indian market.

China-sourced DTC platform shipping children's and family apparel globally at ultra-low prices via app-first distribution, replicating Shein's supply-chain mechanism but in the mom/kids fashion niche rather than Gen-Z trend fashion.
Rocket Internet clone of Wayfair for the European (primarily German) market, offering a large online catalog of home and living products.
Brazil's leading online marketplace specializing in home products, independently replicating the Wayfair model for the Brazilian market.
SSENSE is a Canada-based online-first multi-brand luxury fashion retailer with editorial curation, directly replicating the YNAP model for North America.
Farfetch China operates a luxury fashion marketplace connecting global luxury brands to Chinese affluent consumers, a clear geo-variant of the YNAP mechanism.

Kredivo is an app-first digital credit platform in Indonesia offering instant credit lines and installment loans to underbanked consumers using alternative data, closely matching the Lexin playbook in Southeast Asia.
Belvo is the open finance API platform for Latin America, replicating Plaid's bank-account-linking and data connectivity model for Mexico and the region.
Mono provides open finance APIs connecting apps to bank accounts across Africa (Nigeria), directly replicating Plaid's mechanism for that geography.
TrueLayer is a UK/European open banking API platform enabling apps to connect to bank accounts for payments and financial data, the Plaid equivalent for PSD2 markets.
Thought Machine's Vault is a cloud-native core banking engine sold to banks, directly competing with Mambu from the UK.
Zeta provides a cloud-native core banking platform with card issuance, lending, and ledger capabilities to banks, replicating the Mambu model from the US.
Dock integrates card issuing with core banking services via API for banks and fintechs in Brazil, serving as a Mambu-like core banking infrastructure player in LatAm.
Qonto is a purpose-built digital business bank for SMEs and freelancers in France and across Europe, offering business accounts, team cards, expense management, and accounting integrations.
Mercury provides digital business banking for US startups and tech companies with instant account opening, team card controls, treasury management, and accounting integrations.

Poland-born two-sided marketplace replicating the Zocdoc model across Europe, letting patients discover, compare, and book in-person doctor appointments while offering practice management SaaS to providers.
France-based platform where patients search for and book in-person doctor appointments with real-time availability, a direct Zocdoc geo-adaptation for France and Germany.
Babylon is the UK geo-adaptation of the telemedicine playbook, combining AI-powered triage with live doctor video consultations and NHS/B2G contracts.
Kry is the Swedish/Nordic geo-adaptation, enabling patients to consult licensed doctors via video within the public healthcare reimbursement system.

Dada Group operates JD Daojia (JDDJ), an on-demand retail marketplace that connects consumers with local supermarkets and uses crowdsourced shoppers to pick and deliver from existing retail store shelves — the Instacart model for China.

Rappi operates a multi-category on-demand delivery platform in Latin America where a core use case is grocery personal-shopping from partner supermarkets, with couriers picking items from retail store shelves in Instacart fashion.

Glovo partners with major grocery chains (e.g., Carrefour, Dia) across Europe and MENA, sending couriers to pick items from retail store shelves for same-day delivery, replicating the Instacart mechanism within a broader multi-category platform.
NetEase Cloud Music is China's second-largest on-demand music streaming platform with a freemium model, directly replicating Spotify's playbook for the Chinese market.
Tencent Music Entertainment operates QQ Music, Kugou, and Kuwo — China's dominant freemium on-demand music streaming apps licensing from major and independent labels.
Gaana is India's leading freemium music streaming app offering on-demand Bollywood, regional, and international music via licensed catalogs.
NewsBreak is a US-market AI-powered local and national news aggregation app that replicates the Toutiao model with ML-personalized feeds.
VerSe Innovation (Dailyhunt) is India's leading AI-driven news and content aggregation platform delivering personalized multilingual feeds from third-party publishers.
Glance uses AI to deliver personalized news and content feeds on smartphone lock screens in India, replicating the core ML-aggregation mechanism with a different distribution surface.
99acres is India's prominent consumer-facing real estate classifieds portal aggregating buy/sell/rent listings from agents and owners.
Fang Holdings (SouFun) operates China's major real estate internet portal providing property listings and value-added services to consumers and agents.
Habi is the Opendoor for Colombia, using technology-driven pricing to make instant cash offers on homes and reselling them.
Casavo is the Opendoor for Southern Europe (Italy/Spain), purchasing homes directly from sellers using algorithmic pricing and reselling them.
WeWork China is a direct geo subsidiary replicating the WeWork co-working model in China with shared workspace and community services.
Ucommune is China's leading independent co-working space provider offering flexible office solutions to SMEs, directly replicating the WeWork playbook in China.
Kr Space is the largest co-working space company in China, master-leasing and fitting out design-forward flexible workspaces in the WeWork model.
WhatsApp for China — started as a phone-number-based mobile messaging app and became the dominant communication layer, evolving into a super-app with payments and mini-programs.
WhatsApp for Vietnam — a mobile-first messaging app that is the dominant everyday communication tool in Vietnam with phone-number registration and contact import.
Cloud-based mobile messaging app registered via phone number offering 1:1 and group chat, achieving dominant communication status in several geographies (e.g., Iran, Russia, UAE).
Operates Moj, India's leading short-form video app launched after TikTok's ban, with an algorithmic feed and integrated creator tools — a clear 'Kuaishou for India.'
VerSe Innovation operates Josh, a prominent Indian short-form video app with algorithmic discovery, filling the TikTok void in India.
Gousto is a UK-based meal kit subscription service delivering pre-portioned ingredients with recipes, a clear geographic adaptation of the HelloFresh playbook.
Choco is a known geo-variant (Germany/Europe) that directly replicates the Meicai model by digitizing the ordering process between restaurants and food suppliers.

Jumbotail is a full-stack B2B e-commerce marketplace digitizing food and grocery distribution to small retailers (kirana stores), replicating the core mechanism of aggregating demand from fragmented food businesses and connecting them with upstream suppliers via a digital platform with logistics, th
Enpal is the 'Sunrun for Germany,' leasing residential rooftop solar systems to homeowners at zero upfront cost under long-term contracts while retaining system ownership.

Skydio is the leading US-based autonomous drone manufacturer with proprietary AI-powered flight autonomy, selling hardware to enterprise and government customers—effectively 'DJI for the US' driven by domestic-supply imperatives.
Quantum Systems designs and manufactures AI-powered eVTOL drones for defense, security, and surveying in Germany, replicating the vertically integrated drone platform model for the European market.
Nscale replicates the CoreWeave model in the UK, providing a full-stack AI cloud platform with owned GPU infrastructure for enterprise-scale AI workloads.

Helsing is a German defense-AI company building AI-powered autonomy software for drones and military platforms, serving European NATO defense ministries—a clear geo-locked replication of Shield AI's playbook.

Harmattan AI is a French defense-first startup developing AI-powered autonomous systems and software for military applications, replicating the Shield AI model under France's sovereign defense procurement ecosystem.

Qifu Technology (formerly 360 DigiTech) is a Chinese AI-powered credit tech platform that uses machine learning and big data to assess borrower creditworthiness and partners with financial institutions to facilitate lending decisions.
Venustech is a leading Chinese domestic vendor of network security products (firewalls, IDS/IPS, UTM) serving government and enterprise customers in China's sovereignty-driven market.

Qi An Xin is a major Chinese enterprise security vendor providing comprehensive network security products to government agencies and critical infrastructure operators in China's regulated domestic market.
Israeli SASE platform converging SD-WAN with cloud-native security (SWG, CASB, ZTNA, FWaaS) on a global PoP backbone, directly replicating the Zscaler model from Israel.
Israeli cloud-delivered Network-as-a-Service replacing legacy VPN and firewall stacks with ZTNA, SWG, and FWaaS for distributed workforces on a per-user subscription.
Fiture sells a smart fitness mirror with an integrated display and subscription workout content in China, making it a clear geographic adaptation of the Peloton model.

Keep (China) started as a fitness app but has expanded into selling connected fitness hardware (smart bike, treadmill with screens) paired with subscription workout content, replicating the Peloton hardware-plus-content mechanism in the Chinese market.

Yatsen (Perfect Diary) replicated the Glossier playbook in China, building a massive social-media community on Xiaohongshu and WeChat to drive DTC beauty sales with rapid, data-informed SKU iteration.
Aiven (Finland) offers a multi-product managed platform for open-source data infrastructure (Kafka, PostgreSQL, Redis, etc.), a clear geo variant.
PingCAP develops the open-source distributed SQL database TiDB and monetizes via TiDB Cloud managed service.

Hotmart is a Brazil-originated open creator marketplace (incorporated in NL) where independent instructors sell digital courses and products via revenue share, replicating the Udemy model for Latin America.

Unacademy launched as an open platform in India where independent educators upload video lessons for self-directed learners, though it has since layered on live classes and subscriptions for test prep.
Qapita replicates Carta's cap table, ESOP administration, and equity liquidity platform for the Southeast Asian (Singapore-based) market.
Ledgy is an equity management platform for private and listed companies, managing equity compensation, cap tables, and compliance — a direct Carta-like playbook executed from Switzerland.
Unit is a US-based BaaS platform enabling tech companies to embed bank accounts, cards, and lending via API, operating under partner bank charters — a direct Solaris analogue for the US market.
QI Tech is a Brazilian BaaS platform providing APIs for businesses to offer financial products (credit, payments, digital accounts) under its own regulatory framework — Solaris for Brazil.

UK-based institutional cryptocurrency custody firm providing secure infrastructure (including ClearLoop off-exchange settlement) for institutional digital-asset investors, a direct geographic variant of BitGo for the UK market.
Swiss-regulated digital asset banking group offering institutional custody under a FINMA banking license, serving as the locally regulated custodian for institutional investors in Switzerland.
Alibaba's all-in-one enterprise collaboration suite built around team chat for the China market where Slack is blocked—a textbook geographic variant.
ByteDance's enterprise collaboration suite (Lark/Feishu) centered on team messaging with integrated docs, video, and calendar for Asia-Pacific markets.
Wix replicates the Squarespace drag-and-drop website builder model from Israel with freemium self-serve signup and subscription hosting tiers.
Framer is a Netherlands-based website design and publishing platform using visual editing and template-driven creation, replicating the Squarespace model for a European/global audience.
Acko is a licensed D2C general insurer in India selling auto, health, and other personal-lines policies directly via app/website with tech-driven underwriting.
Digit Insurance is a licensed Indian general insurer offering personal-lines products (auto, home, travel) D2C through digital channels with simplified tech-driven processes.
PolicyBazaar is the clear Indian adaptation of the eHealth model, operating as a multi-carrier insurance comparison and purchase platform for consumers in India.
Waterdrop operates an insurance marketplace in China that connects consumers with multiple insurance carriers for comparison and purchase, replicating the eHealth model for the Chinese market.
Kitopi is a managed cloud kitchen operator in the UAE that runs kitchens on behalf of restaurant brands for delivery, a known example of the playbook.
Muncher partners with restaurant brands to enable off-premise dining in Colombia, suggesting a managed cloud kitchen or kitchen-as-a-service model, though details are limited.
Douyu TV is a leading Chinese game-focused live-streaming platform replicating Twitch's two-sided streamer-viewer marketplace with virtual gifting and subscriptions.
Huya is a Chinese interactive broadcast platform centered on game live streaming with real-time chat, virtual gifts, and streamer monetization, directly mirroring Twitch's model.

Sea's Garena division replicated Tencent's playbook for Southeast Asia—licensing hit titles (League of Legends, later developing Free Fire), building the region's dominant gaming platform, then expanding into e-commerce (Shopee) and digital payments (SeaMoney).

VNG became Vietnam's dominant gaming gateway by licensing and localizing Chinese/Korean MMOs, operating local servers and payment systems, and expanding into messaging (Zalo) and adjacent internet services.
XING is the German-language professional networking platform replicating LinkedIn's model of profiles, connections, and job discovery for the DACH market.

Maimai is China's leading professional social-networking platform with career profiles, real-name connection graphs, content feeds, and job features — a direct LinkedIn replicator for the Chinese market.
Moka is a SaaS-based recruitment platform in China offering employers end-to-end hiring workflow optimization, directly replicating the cloud ATS model for the Chinese market.
Wealthsimple launched as Canada's leading robo-advisor, replicating Betterment's algorithm-driven diversified ETF portfolio management with AUM-based fees for Canadian retail investors.
Scalable Capital originated as Germany's Betterment equivalent, offering algorithm-driven automated portfolio management with ETFs and an AUM-based fee for European retail investors.
Mercado Pago is the direct geographic replication of PayPal's model, built as the embedded payment platform for MercadoLibre's marketplace in Latin America.
MercadoLibre is the integrated parent entity encompassing both the dominant Latin American e-commerce marketplace and Mercado Pago, its PayPal-equivalent payment arm.
Zetwerk is India's leading B2B manufacturing marketplace that connects buyers with a network of manufacturers for custom parts, replicating the Xometry model in the Indian market.
Laserhub is a German industrial procurement platform for custom-made metal parts that provides instant quoting and routes orders to a network of manufacturers, a clear Xometry-for-Germany.
Forto is a German digital freight forwarder offering ocean and rail shipment management with end-to-end visibility, directly replicating the Flexport model for European shippers.
Nowports is a Latin American digital freight forwarder automating international supply chain processes, a clear Flexport-for-Mexico/LatAm variant.
Known example; Latin America's leading multi-category on-demand delivery super-app connecting consumers with restaurants, groceries, pharmacies, and couriers.
Known example; India's multi-category on-demand delivery marketplace for food, grocery, and essentials via gig-economy riders.

Isar Aerospace is a venture-backed German startup building the Spectrum launch vehicle for dedicated small/medium satellite launches, replicating Rocket Lab's model for European sovereign launch access.

Tianbing Technology (Space Pioneer) is a Chinese venture-backed startup developing the Tianlong series of small/medium launch vehicles, replicating the Rocket Lab model for China's domestic launch market.
Rumble is an open video-hosting platform with creator uploads, ad-supported revenue sharing, and recommendation/search, competing directly with YouTube in North America.
Bigo Live is a global social live-streaming platform with virtual gifting as primary monetization, a known example and JOYY subsidiary targeting Southeast Asia and global markets.
Tango Me is a US-based live-streaming platform centered on hosts broadcasting entertainment content monetized primarily through virtual gifting from viewers.
Operates Ohouse, Korea's largest all-in-one interior platform combining user-generated design content, professional matching, and home product commerce—a direct Houzz-for-Korea replication.
India's leading interior design and renovation platform that combines design inspiration content with an end-to-end marketplace connecting homeowners to designers, contractors, and products.
Weibo is China's dominant public microblogging platform with follower graphs, reposts, trending topics, and ad monetization—a direct Twitter analogue for the Chinese market.
Koo App is an Indian public microblogging platform explicitly modeled on Twitter, supporting multi-language short-form posting, trending topics, and public discourse in India.
Tantan is a Chinese swipe-based mobile dating app explicitly modeled on Tinder's card-swipe, mutual-match, and location-based discovery mechanics.
TrulyMadly is an Indian dating app that incorporates swipe-based discovery and mutual matching, serving as a Tinder-like platform adapted for the Indian market.
Tujia is the leading Airbnb-like peer-to-peer vacation rental marketplace in China, replicating the host-listing and transactional booking model for the Chinese market.
Xiaozhu is a Chinese P2P short-term rental platform connecting individual landlords with tenants/travelers via platform-mediated transactions, directly mirroring Airbnb's model.

Mafengwo is a Chinese travel social network centered on user-generated travel experiences, reviews, and guides — a clear 'Tripadvisor for China' with the same UGC-driven SEO and network-effects mechanism.

Dianping is China's leading UGC review platform for restaurants, hotels, and attractions, sharing the same core mechanism of user-generated reviews/ratings creating network effects and an SEO moat, though its primary positioning is local consumption rather than travel-specific.
Chilean food-tech company using AI-driven ingredient optimization to create branded plant-based alternatives to meat, dairy, and eggs, replicating the Beyond Meat model in Latin America.
Innoviz develops automotive-grade LiDAR sensors and perception software with OEM design wins (e.g., BMW), serving as the Israeli geographic variant.
Germany-based team (ex-Stability) training frontier generative visual models (FLUX series) and monetizing through API and commercial licensing.
4Paradigm is the 'DataRobot for China,' providing an end-to-end enterprise ML platform that helps Chinese enterprises operationalize AI across the full lifecycle.
Legora is an explicitly identified geo-variant adapting the Harvey model for the Scandinavian/European legal market, empowering lawyers with AI for document review, research, and drafting.
Torq is an AI-first no-code security automation platform based in Israel, replicating the Tines model as a direct geo variant.
RELX replicates JUUL's closed-pod e-cigarette model with proprietary devices and pods, targeting adult smokers primarily in China.

Mamaearth is India's direct replica of the Honest Company model—a DTC brand that started with toxin-free baby and toddler care products, marketed to health-conscious Indian parents, and expanded into broader personal care and beauty.
Coralogix is an Israel-based SaaS observability platform ingesting logs, metrics, and traces with ML-driven analytics, replicating the Datadog playbook for a different geo origin.
Firebolt is an Israel-based cloud data warehousing platform replicating Snowflake's separated compute/storage model with a focus on sub-second analytics performance.
POIZON replicates the StockX authentication-centered sneaker and streetwear marketplace model for the Chinese/HK Gen-Z market.
UpGrad is the Coursera model replicated in India, partnering with universities like IIIT Bangalore and Liverpool John Moores to deliver online degrees and certificates to working professionals.
Dock is a Brazilian fintech infrastructure provider whose core offering integrates card issuing and processing APIs for third-party fintechs, replicating the Marqeta model for Brazil.
Estonia-based identity verification company providing document and biometric verification APIs to businesses, a clear Trulioo-like model for Europe.
XTransfer replicates the Airwallex model for Chinese foreign trade enterprises, offering cross-border B2B payment and FX/risk-control infrastructure.
Alpaca provides a brokerage API enabling developers and businesses to embed securities trading and investing into their apps, directly replicating the DriveWealth model with roots in Japan.
Foodics is a restaurant management system in Saudi Arabia offering POS, payments, inventory, employee scheduling, and CRM — a clear Toast-for-MENA replication.
Filevine is a US-based legal operating platform covering case management, document management, and lead management for law firms, directly competing with Clio.
Pigment is a France-based business forecasting and planning platform explicitly positioned as a next-generation Anaplan alternative with European go-to-market and data residency.
UiPath is a Romania-origin enterprise RPA platform offering software robots, orchestration, and per-bot licensing in direct replication of the Blue Prism model.
Israel-based replication of the Asana playbook with a more visual, no-code orientation, serving cross-functional teams via freemium per-seat subscriptions.
n8n is the open-source Zapier alternative from Germany, replicating the trigger-action workflow automation model with self-hosted and cloud options and a freemium distribution wedge.
Alan is the direct French geo-adaptation of Oscar's model, operating as a licensed digital health insurer with a consumer-grade app experience for employer health insurance in France.
Wayflyer is the acknowledged European (Ireland) replication of the Clearco model, providing revenue-based funding and marketing analytics to e-commerce businesses.
Konfio is a known geographic replication of the Kabbage model in Mexico, providing automated, data-driven credit to underserved Mexican SMBs.
Dream11 is India's leading daily fantasy sports platform where users draft real-athlete lineups and compete in paid-entry contests, replicating the FanDuel model for the Indian market.
Awardco is a direct US competitor specializing in employee recognition and rewards with a points-based redemption catalog (Amazon integration), sold per-employee to corporate HR.
Lattice is a direct US competitor offering the same engagement surveys, continuous performance reviews, OKR tracking, and people analytics as a standalone point solution for HR teams.

Judo Bank is a clear Australian geographic adaptation of the OakNorth model—a challenger bank built specifically for relationship-based SME lending using technology to serve the underbanked mid-market segment.
Ankorstore is a known Faire-for-Europe variant, connecting independent shop owners with specialist brands via a curated wholesale marketplace with buyer-friendly terms in France/EU.

Former anchor, demoted in Phase 3b re-election. Original rationale: Moglix is the canonical anchor — a B2B e-commerce marketplace aggregating MRO and industrial supplies for manufacturing enterprises with integrated logistics and financing.
MGI Tech is a China-based sequencing instrument manufacturer (DNBSEQ series) with proprietary consumables, representing the clearest 'Illumina for China' pattern.
Chinese biotech with proprietary H2L2 and HCAb transgenic mouse platforms for fully-human and heavy-chain-only antibody discovery, licensed to partners while building its own pipeline.
Brazilian freight technology platform using technology to connect carriers with truck drivers, replicating the digital trucking marketplace model in Brazil.
Shiprocket replicates the Shippo model in India, aggregating multiple carriers for e-commerce merchants with rate comparison, label generation, and integration with Indian e-commerce platforms.

ICEYE operates a proprietary SAR micro-satellite constellation from Finland, selling all-weather Earth observation data and analytics — a direct geographic variant of the Planet model using radar instead of optical sensors.
Iwjw operated a technology-powered O2O brokerage in China with directly hired agents equipped with mobile technology for property transactions, though primarily focused on rentals.
Bird (formerly MessageBird) is a Netherlands-based CPaaS platform offering enterprise communication APIs across SMS, WhatsApp, and voice, a clear geo replication of the Vonage model.

HyalRoute operates shared communication fiber infrastructure in Southeast Asia, leasing network access to multiple carriers and enterprises, serving as a Crown Castle-like neutral-host InfraCo for the Singapore/APAC geography.

Zhihu is China's leading Q&A knowledge community replicating Quora's core mechanism—user-posted questions, long-form community answers, upvoting, topic organization, SEO distribution, and ad/premium monetization—for the Chinese market.
Snow is a camera-first photo/video app with localized AR filters and stickers, replicating Snapchat's core mechanism for the South Korean market.
China's leading visual lifestyle social feed combining user-generated photo/video reviews of fashion, beauty, and travel with social commerce discovery — a direct Instagram-for-China analogue.

Klook is a known example replicating the GetYourGuide model for the Asia-Pacific market, offering travelers a mobile-first marketplace to discover and book local tours, attractions, and experiences with commission-based monetization.
ixigo is a known Indian travel metasearch platform that aggregates and compares fares across OTAs and suppliers, replicating Skyscanner's model for India.
